questions.question: Which of the following MRB actions would almost certainly require the involvement of the customer, when a noncomforming product is discovered internally?
options: Rework or repair of the product
Reject of scrap of the project
questions.answer: Rework or repair of the product

questions.question: In ANSI/ASQ Z1.4, the AQL is always determined at what Pa on the OC curve?
Two quantities which uniquely determine a single sampling attributes plan are:

An inspection performance audit is made of eight inspectors in an area of complex assembly, all doing similar work. Seven inspectors have an average monthly acceptance rate of 86% to 92%; one inspector has an average rate of 72% with approximately four times the daily variation as the others. Based on this audit, you should, as inspection supervisor;
options: Promote the 72% inspector since he/she is very conscientious
Discipline the 72% inspector since he/she is creating needless rework and wasted time
Initiate a special investigation of inspection and manufacturing performance
Discipline the other seven inspectors since they are not "cracking down"
questions.answer: Initiate a special investigation of inspection and manufacturing performance

questions.question: When planning quality control functions, which of the following is most directly related to production of a quality product?
Using ANSI/ASQ Z1.4, determine the sample size(s) for a lot of 300, AQL = 0.4%, level II normal inspection, double sampling:
In the planning of a new major manufacturing program, the greatest quality effort should be put logically in:
options: Prevention of occurrence of substandard quality
questions.answer: Prevention of occurrence of substandard quality

questions.question: The AQL (accepted quality limit) for a given sampling plan is 1%. This means that:
options: There is a small risk that lots with 1% defective or less are rejected
All accepted lots are 1% defective or less
All lots are 1% defective or less
The average quality level of the plan is 1%
questions.answer: There is a small risk that lots with 1% defective or less are rejected

questions.question: When any discontinuity is of such size, shape, type, and location that it creates a substantial chance of material failure in service, it is commonly called which of the following?
What is the importance of the reaction plan in a control plan?
options: It describes what will happen if a key variable goes out of control
It indicates that a new team must be formed to react to a problem
It lists how often the process should be monitored
It defines the special characteristics to be monitored
questions.answer: It describes what will happen if a key variable goes out of control

questions.question: ANSI/ASQ Z1.4 sampling plans allow reduced inspection when four requirements are met. One of these is:
options: 10 lots have been on normal inspection and none have been rejected
The process average is less than the AOQL
The maximum percent defective is less than the AQL
questions.answer: 10 lots have been on normal inspection and none have been rejected

questions.question: The steeper the OC curve, the:
options: Less protection for both producer and consumer
More protection for both producer and consumer
questions.answer: More protection for both producer and consumer

questions.question: The implementation of a control plan in the painting department was so successful that at master black belt wants you to implement the same control plan in the final assembly line. What changes should be made before implementing the necessary control plan?
options: Each control plan is unique, a new plan must be developed for the final assembly line
A lot of changes will be necessary
No changes are needed, since the two areas are in the same company
Minor changes may be necessary to reflect the assebly line differences
questions.answer: Each control plan is unique, a new plan must be developed for the final assembly line

questions.question: Random selection of a smaple:
options: Theoretically means that each item in the lot had an equal chance to be selected
Ensures that the sample average will equal the population average
Means that a table of random numbers was used to dictate the selection
questions.answer: Theoretically means that each item in the lot had an equal chance to be selected

questions.question: The most important activity of a material review board (MRB) would normally be:
options: Making sure that corrective action is taken to prevent recurrence of the problem
To provide a segregated area for holding discrepant material pending disposition
To prepare discrepant material reports for management review
To accept discrepant material when "commercial" decisions dictate
questions.answer: Making sure that corrective action is taken to prevent recurrence of the problem

questions.question: When inspection identification is required on a batch of parts and the parts are too small to identify individually, which of the following actions is most appropriate?
options: Ignore the request and concentrate on parts that can be identified
Record the inspection information on the routing slip
Attach an inspection tag, card, or label to the container containing the parts
Refer the matter to the material review board
questions.answer: Attach an inspection tag, card, or label to the container containing the parts

questions.question: A sampling plan from ANSI/ASQ Z1.4 for reduced inspection accepts one (1) and rejects three (3). If two (2) defects are found, one should:
options: Accept the lot and return to normal inspection
Move to the next sampling plan
questions.answer: Accept the lot and return to normal inspection

questions.question: Which of the following inspection activities is used to distinguish good lots from bad lots?
The purpose of a written inspection procedure is to:
options: Let the operator know what the inspector is doing
Standardize methods and procedures of inspectors
questions.answer: Standardize methods and procedures of inspectors

questions.question: Which of the following activities might be the most important action of the MRB?
options: Deciding what to do with scrap material
Deciding what to do with nonconforming material
Deciding when to call the customer regarding borderline material
Deciding when corrective action is necessary
questions.answer: Deciding when corrective action is necessary

questions.question: In comparison with attributes sampling plans, variables sampling planes:
options: Have the advantage of greater simplicity
Usually require a larger sample size for comparable assurance as to the correctness of decisions
Have the advantage of being applicable to either single or multiple quality characteristics
Provide greater assurance, for the same sample size, as to the correctness of decisions
questions.answer: Provide greater assurance, for the same sample size, as to the correctness of decisions

questions.question: Which of the following terms represents permission in writing to accept for use, a completed but nonconforming item, either "as is" or upon completion of rework for a given number of units or specified period of time?
Which of the following elements would be expected on a control plan form?
Precision can be best defined as:
options: The ability to target a process to a specified normal value
The average reading determined after repeated measurements by different operators
The difference between the repeated measurements on the same item
The agreement of closeness of measurements on the same item
questions.answer: The agreement of closeness of measurements on the same item

questions.question: The yellow faceplate on a dial indicates that the instrument:
options: Is in metric instead of English units
Has a revolution counter which contains part of the measurement
Has a balanced, not a continuous, dial readout
questions.answer: Is in metric instead of English units

questions.question: A subsurface discontinuity in some purchased steel bar stock is suspected to be the cause of high failure rates. Which of the following nondestructive test (NDT) methods could be used to screen the bar stock?
options: Magnetic particle and eddy current testing
questions.answer: Magnetic particle and eddy current testing

questions.question: True testing variability can be obtained in a destructive testing situation under which of the following conditions?
options: All samples are taken closely together
The same person and instrument are used

questions.question: When using a sine bar to measure an angle, the height of the gage block setting is determined by multiplying the sine of the angle by:
options: The width of the gage blocks
The height of the gage blocks
The length of the adjacent side
The length of the sine bar
questions.answer: The length of the sine bar

questions.question: When making measurements with test instruments, precision and accuracy mean:
What test is performed by applying a uniaxial load to a test bar and gradually increasing the load until the bar or coupon breaks?
Products should be subjected to tests which are designed to:
options: Demonstrate the basic function at a minimum testing cost
Approximate the conditions to be experienced in the customer's application
Ensure that specifications are met under laboratory conditions
Ensure performance under severe environmental conditions
questions.answer: Ensure that specifications are met under laboratory conditions

questions.question: When considering whether to use radiographic or ultrasonic inspection to examine critical welds in thick materials, which of the following si the best reason for this selection?
options: Ultrasonic, since greater thicknesses can be penetrated
Radiography, since ultrasonic is less sensitive to porosity and inclusions
Both, since the methods complement rather than supplant one another
Both, since each is equally effective, the chance of missing a serious flaw is reduced
questions.answer: Both, since the methods complement rather than supplant one another

questions.question: The most essential value of a surface plate in precision measurement application is which of the following?
options: It provides a flat working surface
It provides a surface free of minor vibration
It provides an accurate reference surface
It provides a chemically resistant work surface
questions.answer: It provides an accurate reference surface

questions.question: When specifying the "10:1 calibration principle", one is referring to:
options: The ratio of the frequency of calibration of a secondary standard to a primary standard
The ratio of the frequency of calibration of the instrument to that of the primary standard
The ratio of the main scale to vernier scale calibration
The ratio of calibration standard accuracy to calibrated instrument accuracy
questions.answer: The ratio of calibration standard accuracy to calibrated instrument accuracy

questions.question: Which of the following is a true statement regarding the use of pneumatic gages?
options: The equipment is both fast and accurate
The equipment must be cleaned frequently
Only variable measurements can be made
questions.answer: The equipment is both fast and accurate

questions.question: When measuring part angles to great accuracy, the best instrument to select would be which of the following?
q
q
q
q
q
q
q
q
q
q
q
q
